intro: Rondeletia atravesadensis, commonly known as the black-eyed rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, dark purple to black flowers that contrast with its green foliage. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its unique coloration and ornamental value make it a sought-after species in horticulture.
